overview:
Kirshner began his career at 24/7 Real Media as an account executive, before serving as a founding member of SendTraffic.com, a New York-based search engine marketing firm, which he was instrumental in helping grow from three to over 25 employees before the company was sold to Traffix, Inc. (NASDAQ: TRFX) in May 2004.

Ben is an Adjunct Instructor at New York Universityâ€™s School of Continuing and Professional Studies. He is a frequent guest lecturer on Search Engine Marketing strategies at various universities, has been quoted in nationwide news publications including the Wall Street Journal, and featured in trade journals such as Automatic Merchandiser. He also serves as a consultant for The Gerson Lehrman Group, currently ranked in the top 5% of over 100,000 consultants worldwide.

Ben graduated from The George Washington University where he received dual BA degrees in Entrepreneurship and Tourism & Hospitality Management.

Ben is an active member of Entrepreneur Organization (EO) and serves on the board of advisors at FIT’s marketing department
